text: How can you determine whether the outcomes of a probability event are all equally likely? Why would this information matter if you are using the outcomes to make a decision?

To determine if all outcomes of a probability are equally likely you need to consider all the possible outcomes. Then you must look at each outcome and see if each outcome has an equal chance of occurring. This information would be important in making decisions because if an outcome isnâ€™t as likely to occur you may not want to select that outcome. And it may not be considered a fair chance.
